section.name: Overview
section.p: The jq-test-mobile-war module is a sample web application, for a mobile browser, used to test tz-commons.

body.section:
Here are some things that are not automatically configured for jq-test-mobile-war, when importing the poms into Eclipse [TODO-p1(george) - this may be an issue with my version of Eclipse and default settings]:
Eclipse Project Facets: Check 'Dynamic Web Module' (and choose version 2.5, for Tomcat v6).
For further configuration of the Web Module, I unchecked this, since I already have a web.xml file. Also, for maven, set "Content Directory" to "src/main/webapp".
Eclipse Deployment Assembly: Add the Maven Dependencies (also needed anytime 'Maven :: Update Project Configuration' is used).
Maven Workspace Project dependencies: Uncheck this to avoid build and runtime issues.
Eclipse Web Modules: Eclipse will add '-war' back to the path, if you attempt to remove it, when the module is first added to the server (as well as other times). If upon startup, you receive a 404 error, return to this step and ensure '-war' is still missing (it can reappear). [TODO-p1(george) - this is likely a pom mis-configuration].
